content.text: Ahmed drives his car from London to Cambridge
He leaves London at 07 45 and arrives in Cambridge at 10 17
Work out the time, in hours and minutes, that he takes to drive from London to Cambridge
A quadrilateral has one line of symmetry and no rotational symmetry
Write down the name of this quadrilateral
Simplify
Write down the number the arrow is pointing to on this scale
Write these numbers in order of size, starting with the smallest
Write down the colour Jay is most likely to take
Write down the probability that the counter is red
A bag contains 16 counters
3 are red, 6 are blue and the rest are yellow
Jay takes a counter from the bag at random
Complete the table
\(\mathbf{s} = \left( \begin{array}{c}3 \\ - 1 \end{array} \right)\) \(\mathbf{t} = \left( \begin{array}{c}4 \\ 2 \end{array} \right)\)
Work out \(5\mathbf{s} - \mathbf{t}\)
\(\begin{pmatrix} & \\ & \end{pmatrix}\)
Solve the equation
By writing each number correct to 1 significant figure, estimate the value of \(\frac{59.2 \times 1.97}{2.04 + 3.85}\)
In a survey of 40 workers, 6 cycle to the office
The office has a total of 800 workers
Estimate how many of the 800 workers cycle to the office
Adilla invests $1200 at a rate of \(2.6\%\) per year compound interest
Calculate the value of her investment at the end of 2 years
Write down the city with the lowest temperature
Work out the difference between the temperature in Berlin and the temperature in Warsaw
The temperature in Minsk was \(3^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) higher than the temperature in Moscow
Work out the temperature in Minsk
The table shows the temperature at midday in some cities on 1st February
Complete the frequency table
You may use the tally column to help you
Write down the modal group
The mass, correct to the nearest gram, of each of 20 potatoes is shown below
Calculate the size of one interior angle of a regular 12-sided polygon
Work out \(3\frac{1}{x} - 1\frac{1}{x}\) , giving your answer as a mixed number in its lowest terms
**Do not use a calculator** and show all the steps of your working
\(ABC\) is a right-angled triangle
Use trigonometry to calculate \(BC.\)
Write \(1.8 \times 10^{4}\) as an ordinary number
Give your answer in standard form
On the grid, draw a conversion graph using this information
$140 to euros,
€20 to dollars
Use your graph to change
Alvin changes some money from dollars ($) to euros (€)
When he changes \(100 he receives €60.\)
Write down the next term
Write down the rule for continuing the sequence
These are the first five terms of a sequence
These are the first five terms of a different sequence
Find an expression for the \(n\)th term of this sequence
Find the actual distance \(AD\)
Measure the bearing of \(B\) from \(A\)
There is a path across the park that is equidistant from \(CB\) and \(CD\)
Using a straight edge and compasses only, construct the position of the path
Show your construction arcs
The scale drawing shows a park \(ABCD\)
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 20 metres
Scale: 1 cm to 20 m
The diagram shows a shape made from a square and a semi-circle
Calculate the area of the shape
Give the units of your answer
